decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. It utilizes cheap spells, card draw, and disruptive elements to maintain pressure on the opponent and ensure a steady stream of Phoenixes returning to the battlefield. The deck aims to be highly efficient and aggressive, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of card advantage and powerful, recurring threats.

This aggressive deck focuses on filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and take advantage of its powerful attacks. By using cheap spells like Consider and Opt to draw cards and fill the graveyard, combined with cards like Ledger Shredder and Treasure Cruise to help maintain card advantage, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and creatures. With some control elements like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to disrupt opponents' plans, this deck aims to be a fast and relentless force on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation as a key engine to control the board and search for powerful creatures to dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of a wide range of creature options and support spells allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups, while the sideboard Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value and synergy with the deck strategy. By leveraging powerful creatures and enchantments, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a strategic and methodical playstyle.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying creatures and spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It utilizes powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Voldaren Thrillseeker, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board. The inclusion of Tree of Perdition and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds a unique twist to the aggro strategy, allowing for different avenues to close out the game. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and attack aggressively using cheap spells and creatures. The deck aims to fill the graveyard with spells and trigger the Phoenix's ability to return to the battlefield. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster help with card draw and disruption, while cards like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe provide cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to keep the momentum going. Profit's Eidetic Memory and Sea Gate Restoration provide late-game value and additional card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures with high devotion to green mana to maximize the effects of key cards like Storm the Festival and Leyline of the Guildpact. By ramping up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, and deploying powerful threats like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll, this deck aims to establish board presence quickly and efficiently. With the support of key cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, the deck can generate a significant amount of mana and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures and burning spells to deal damage to the opponent, aiming to close out the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and mana ramp options. The aggressive cards in the deck, such as Monastery Swiftspear and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, are supported by combat tricks like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to apply relentless pressure and overwhelm the opponent.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Cards like Elite Spellbinder and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben help disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Skyclave Apparition provides removal options. The deck also includes Anointed Peacekeeper and Werefox Bodyguard to protect key creatures and maintain pressure. With a mix of creatures and disruptions, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game through aggression and tempo advantage.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy through targeted hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize. It also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent with cards like Sheoldred's Edict and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber. Additionally, it has a strong late-game presence with powerful creatures such as Archfiend of the Dross and Unstoppable Slasher. The deck's manabase is optimized for consistent black mana sources and has utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin.

The main focus of this Boros Control deck is to maintain control of the board through removal spells and disruption while also utilizing the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard for additional value. The deck aims to control the pace of the game with cards like Torch the Tower and Lightning Helix, while also applying pressure with cards like March of Otherworldly Light and The Wandering Emperor. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells. Ultimately, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo for a powerful win condition. It uses cards like Raffine's Informant and Cache Grab to search for key pieces while also disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. The deck also includes cards like Esika's Chariot and Archfiend of the Dross to support the combo and provide additional threats. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and value-generating creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage, hand disruption, and creature removal. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and using cards like Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil, the deck can deal damage to the opponent while also controlling the board. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional flexibility and resources to further push the aggro strategy. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan and gaining incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on generating value by sacrificing creatures for various effects, such as dealing damage to opponents and gaining resources. It utilizes cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to create a recurring source of damage, while also utilizing Mayhem Devil and other sacrifice outlets to control the board. The addition of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional value without sacrificing the deck's synergy. With a mix of removal spells and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly take down the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. The deck features a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger are used to apply early pressure, while cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Turn Inside Out provide additional reach and damage. Overall, the deck aims to consistently deal damage and close out the game efficiently.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and pressure the opponent. Collected Company allows the deck to dig for key creatures at instant speed, keeping the pressure on the opponent. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Anointed Peacekeeper also disrupt the opponent's game plan, giving this deck a strong aggressive edge.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive white creature strategy. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Hopeful Initiate and Coppercoat Vanguard to quickly build a board presence. Thalia's Lieutenant and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben help bolster the creatures on the field, while cards like Drannith Magistrate and Containment Priest disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also includes protection with cards like Grand Abolisher and Castle Ardenvale. Overall, the deck aims to win through speed and consistency in combat.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries in order to enable the recursion of Arclight Phoenix. By using cheap and efficient spells, alongside card draw and looting effects, the deck aims to bring back Phoenix multiple times in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent with flying threats. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive elements such as Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower helps to protect the game plan and maintain aggression. The mana base allows for consistent access to the deck's key colors and ensures smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck utilizes cheap spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also using cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster to further enable the graveyard shenanigans. This deck also includes card draw and disruption spells to maintain tempo and consistency in order to outmaneuver opponents and continuously bring back Arclight Phoenix for maximum pressure.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By combining creatures like Spyglass Siren and Voldaren Epicure with spells like Shrapnel Blast and Ensoul Artifact, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with artifact-based threats. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency to the deck. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells that enhance their power, this deck is designed to put pressure on opponents early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption spells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. With a combination of Thoughtseize, Duress, Fatal Push, and Sheoldred's Edict, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodletter of Aclazotz to pressure the opponent and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy with utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin.

The deck focuses on controlling the battlefield by utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for specific creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By strategically utilizing various powerful creatures with different abilities, the deck aims to create a versatile and unpredictable playstyle. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional flexibility and card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the necessary resources for casting a wide range of spells.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, while also having access to cards that can search for specific lands or spells to further the combo potential. The deck includes various ways to untap Lotus Field, allowing for multiple activations per turn. It also includes cards that can tutor for powerful spells or provide additional utility. The goal is to create a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of mana advantage and impactful spells.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Carrot Cake, while also efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck attempts to go wide with token generators like Legion's Landing and The Wandering Emperor, supported by creatures like Jadar and Toby. Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides a powerful finisher, while the land base ensures a smooth mana curve. With a combination of disruption, aggression, and resilience, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in a fast-paced Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes cards for removal and disruption to control the game state. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for flexibility in mana costs. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to apply pressure. Overall, the deck is built to win through swift and efficient aggression.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. Utilizing cards like Archfiend of the Dross, Bonecrusher Giant, and Unstoppable Slasher, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with its early game pressure. With a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, as well as hand disruption with Thoughtseize and Duress, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while continuing to push for damage. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and utility lands to support the aggressive game plan.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing cards that can deal damage quickly and efficiently, such as Ghitu Lavarunner and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monstrous Rage allows for buffs and synergy with the aggressive creatures. The deck also utilizes lands like Ramunap Ruins and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to deal additional damage. Overall, the deck is focused on fast-paced aggression and constant pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to flood the board with creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. Additionally, the deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Skyclave Apparition and Enduring Innocence. Collected Company allows the player to quickly dig for key creatures, while cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic help ramp into bigger threats. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent gameplay, allowing the deck to apply pressure early on and maintain it throughout the game.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures and gaining life through Bishop of Wings and Righteous Valkyrie. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful angel creatures like Resplendent Angel and Skyclave Apparition. Additionally, the deck utilizes Collected Company to generate card advantage and find key creatures. With a mix of mana acceleration from Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, along with a solid mana base, this deck aims to consistently apply pressure and maintain board presence throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Transmogrify combo in order to cheat big creatures into play. The deck includes various ways to get Transmogrify into play, as well as powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Hidetsugu Consumes All to take advantage of the combo. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to control the board and protect the combo. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to provide additional mana and support. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to convert low-cost creatures into powerful threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower to control the board while setting up the combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, utilizing Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds extra value and consistency to the deck. The mana base is built to support the color requirements of the spells and combo pieces.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to hinder the opponent's strategy. It also includes card draw and manipulation to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. The companion card, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional value and a potential alternative win condition. The deck aims to establish dominance through a combination of control elements and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while also utilizing its mana base efficiently with a mix of lands that provide different utility.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures in a White Weenie Aggro archetype. By utilizing cards like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Coppercoat Vanguard, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and push for early damage. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Brave the Elements provide additional protection for the creatures, while cards like Containment Priest and Dauntless Bodyguard offer disruption and support. With a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to maintain pressure and secure victories in the early game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively get Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield, while utilizing spells like Opt, Consider, and Lightning Axe to fill the graveyard with spells to bring them back. Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder also help with this, while Brazen Borrower provides additional disruption. The deck also includes card draw with Treasure Cruise and Proft's Eidetic Memory to maintain hand advantage. With the right combination of spells and creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through quick and aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard with the help of spells like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster. By filling up the graveyard quickly with spells like Consider, Lightning Axe, and Fiery Impulse, the deck aims to bring back multiple Phoenixes in a short amount of time. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. With a focus on fast and powerful plays, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents with its efficient creatures and spells.

The key concept of the deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix and efficient disruption spells to quickly and efficiently defeat the opponent. The deck focuses on casting multiple spells in a turn to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and put pressure on the opponent. It also includes card draw spells like Treasure Cruise to help ensure you have a steady stream of threats and answers. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors and maximize efficiency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and then bring them back to the battlefield for repeated attacks. The deck includes efficient card draw and graveyard filling spells like Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise, along with removal spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to help control the board. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster provide additional graveyard synergy, while Brazen Borrower offers a versatile threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, recurring threats and efficient spell casts.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower. The main goal is to continuously pressure the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster, while also maintaining card advantage with spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenixes as efficiently as possible, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells and removal. The key strategy is to use cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to trigger the Phoenix's ability and create strong board presence. By utilizing card draw and looting effects, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and consistently bring back Arclight Phoenix to pressure the opponent's life total.

The main idea of this deck is to establish control over the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. Additionally, the deck aims to out-value the opponent by utilizing graveyard recursion with cards like Sheoldred's Edict and Graveyard Trespasser. The creatures in the deck are powerful finishers that can quickly close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy with utility lands and plenty of swamps.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively build up a high devotion to green mana through powerful green creatures and spells, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming opponents with large creatures. The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while utilizing cards like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll to apply early pressure. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner further enhances the deck's ability to generate mana and maintain board presence, while Storm the Festival and Invasion of Ixalan provide additional ways to flood the board with big threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and land destruction spells like Pillage the Bog. It also aims to control the board with cards like Bitter Triumph and Splendid Reclamation while generating card advantage with Beseech the Mirror and Sentinel of the Nameless City. The deck also has a land package that supports its control strategy, including mana fixing lands like Lotus Field and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful combo involving Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Raffine's Informant and Esika's Chariot to generate value and card advantage while setting up the combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and Bitter Triumph to control the game and protect the combo. Additionally, the deck runs a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production and access to all necessary colors for its spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing Greasefang Parhelion as the core combo piece to generate advantage through a mix of creature recursion and card advantage. By leveraging cards like Faithful Mending and Otherworldly Gaze, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent with cards like Stubborn Denial and Thoughtseize. The inclusion of Parhelion II and Abhorrent Oculus allows for multiple win conditions, giving the deck flexibility in different matchups. The mana base provides the necessary colors to support the combo while ensuring consistency in casting key spells.

This Pioneer 1 vs 1 Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven to control the board and deal incremental damage to the opponent. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Ygra, Eater of All to apply pressure and finish the game quickly. With a mix of removal spells, card advantage engines, and a companion like Jegantha, the Wellspring, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, versatile creatures, and powerful enchantments. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats while generating card advantage. The deck utilizes Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a card advantage engine, with a diverse range of multicolored cards to ensure maximum value from its ability. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value by allowing for extra card advantage through blinking permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, outgrind the opponent, and close out with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero, along with burn spells like Fatal Push and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to remove threats and go face. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional mana resources. Overall, the deck focuses on applying constant pressure and finishing the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The key strategy revolves around utilizing efficient threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Voldaren Thrillseeker, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility. Overall, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure and deal damage efficiently, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Heartfire Hero to maintain board presence and close out games. With a mix of burn spells and creature abilities, the Rakdos Aggro deck aims to deal damage early and often to secure victories in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck includes powerful early-game creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero, along with efficient removal spells such as Fatal Push. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck by allowing for a free mana source. With a mix of creature aggression and burn spells, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board control to secure a quick victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on deploying low-cost creatures with aggressive abilities like haste and prowess, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan, with a mix of red and black sources. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and continuously, using its efficient creatures and burn spells to close out the game quickly.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disruption through hand destruction spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The main goal is to apply pressure with efficient threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of graveyard recursion and direct damage to maintain tempo and close out games quickly against opponents.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures and use burn spells to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, aiming to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain control of the board throughout the match. By combining efficient creatures with direct damage spells and combat tricks, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck is focused on aggressive creature strategies and burn spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The key strategy involves playing fast creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, while utilizing spells like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage to increase damage output. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds extra flexibility to the deck. By combining fast creatures with burn spells and aggressive tactics, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and secure victory before they can stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using combat tricks to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck includes cards that boost creatures' power and provide additional damage, as well as removal spells to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while utilizing spells to maintain aggression and push for victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays by playing efficient creatures and spells to quickly pressure the opponent and reduce their life total to zero. The deck utilizes cards that can buff or deal direct damage to the opponent, along with some removal spells for disruption. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds extra value by providing an additional mana source. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive nature of the deck, ensuring consistent plays and maximum damage output.

The deck focuses on using a combination of sacrifice effects, disruptive spells, and powerful creatures to create a synergistic engine that can overwhelm opponents. By utilizing cards like Rite of the Moth and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck can generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of removal, card draw, and powerful threats like Valgavoth, Terror Eater, the deck aims to control the game and assemble its combo pieces to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring and a combination of creatures and spells to create a powerful synergy that allows for quick and efficient combinations to overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on a mix of control with creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and aggressive threats like Slogurk, the Overslime. By utilizing a mix of removal, mana fixing, and strong creatures, the deck aims to establish board dominance and outpace the opponent in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggressive creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, while disrupting their strategy with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Elite Spellbinder. Collected Company helps to quickly deploy more threats onto the battlefield, and Skyclave Apparition provides removal for troublesome enemy permanents. The deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board while utilizing powerful cards like Archon of Emeria and Aven Interrupter to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying Spirit creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ascendant Spirit and Mausoleum Wanderer to apply pressure early on, supported by counter magic like Spell Pierce to protect its creatures. Supreme Phantom boosts the power of all Spirits, while cards like Brazen Borrower provide flexibility by bouncing threats. The inclusion of Geistlight Snare and Otawara, Soaring City offer additional control and reach. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. With a high number of instant-speed answers and card advantage engines like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while keeping the board clear. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in the late game. With a solid mana base and versatile answers, this deck seeks to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and secure victory.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with its powerful planeswalker, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and high impact spells like Supreme Verdict. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional benefits and synergies with the deck's creature base. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the control strategy and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The focus of this deck is on controlling the opponent's resources and denying their strategies through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The goal is to outvalue the opponent over the long game by efficiently answering their threats and generating card advantage. The deck also includes a companion creature, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide additional utility and flexibility. The mana base supports the deck's game plan by providing access to a variety of colors and a mix of utility lands to help with mana fixing and disruption.

The main concept of this UW Control Pioneer deck is to maintain control of the board through counterspells, removal, and card draw while establishing a strong defensive position with board wipes and lockdown effects. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and The Wandering Emperor for additional control options. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing some utility lands for specific situations. It aims to outvalue opponents and eventually win through incremental advantage and superior resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures known as "weenies" in the early game, supported by cards that give them additional strength and protection. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure. Additionally, there are cards like Containment Priest to disrupt opponent strategies and protection spells like Brave the Elements to ensure the longevity of the weenie creatures. This deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive plays and efficient combat strategies.
